Hi! I have a question on controlling VictorSPX and SparkMax simultaneously (using arcade drive)

Question: Is it possible to use 2 VictorSPX and 2 SparkMax to control a 4 CIM motors drivetrain?
Iâ€™m planning on controlling 2 left motors with VictorSPX and 2 right motors with SparkMax.

Thank you,
Stephen.

There shouldnâ€™t be any problem doing it, but you wonâ€™t be able to use follower mode across manufacturers; youâ€™ll have to set both motors manually.

Sure! This is the problem:
The constructor DifferentialDrive(VictorSPX, CANSparkMax) is undefinedJava(134217858)

How can I fix that?
Thank you so much.

Your problem isnâ€™t related to mixing VictorSPX and CANSparkMax, but not using the VictorSPX correctly with the WPI drive classes.

docs.ctre-phoenix.com

WPI/NI Software Integration

The stock software frameworks in the FRC control system has several features used by teams. To leverage these features, the C++ /Java Phoenix API has six additional classes: WPI_TalonFX, WPI_TalonS...
